thread.title: Gordon Ramsay is obliterating amateur cooking on Twitter
thread.title_full: Gordon Ramsay is obliterating amateur cooking on Twitter

author: Tom Murray
title: Gordon Ramsay is obliterating amateur cooking on Twitter
text:
Polite. Reserved. Genteel. Restrained. 
These are all words you probably wouldn't use to describe TV chef, Gordon Ramsay. 
In fact, the sweary Scot is probably better-known for his expletive-laden diatribes than he is for his Michelin stars. 
Ramsay's biting affronts have been a source of great entertainment for Twitter users over the past few days, as fans have sent in their homemade dishes for the chef to judge, 
As you might have expected, he hasn't held back. 
Here are some of his best responses: 
Hey Gordon. How about giving my cheese egg mayo toast a spot on your restaurant menu. @GordonRamsay pic.twitter.com/jVizpjXmGR â Ali Redha (@AliRedhaOY) February 21, 2017 
Looks like the inside of my grand dads colostomy bag https://t.co/D9YGdx4Bm1 â Gordon Ramsay (@GordonRamsay) February 21, 2017 
Don't hold back, Gordon. â Ayan (@Ayybolognese) February 21, 2017 
Did it just come back up ? https://t.co/zYimz63dI1 â Gordon Ramsay (@GordonRamsay) February 21, 2017 
This was never going to go down well: 
@GordonRamsay What do you think of my Buffalo wings? pic.twitter.com/XDQOB5N2ly â Ian Stephens (@IanStep6725) February 22, 2017 
I'm more worried about your bon app-a-feet.... disgusting, seriously? https://t.co/luXKvMkYhV â Gordon Ramsay (@GordonRamsay) February 22, 2017 
Asian cuisine didn't go down well either: 
@GordonRamsay how about this? Special fried chicken with chili pastes & rice! pic.twitter.com/Ymv8nlOG8x â ç§ăŽĺĺăŻăŚăľăŽă§ăďź o (^âż^âż) (@Fieza1225) February 22, 2017 
Your finger bowl looks more appealing https://t.co/3AhObIVCsJ â Gordon Ramsay (@GordonRamsay) February 22, 2017 
@GordonRamsay pretty sure this is the best poached egg in a noodle soup you will see all day! pic.twitter.com/rzoPjgis7Y â Chris B (@chrisEbon) February 19, 2017 
Looks like toxic scum on a stagnant pool https://t.co/3Rf6s62Rgk â Gordon Ramsay (@GordonRamsay) February 19, 2017 
He's probably not the best person to make a foodie faux pas with. 
@GordonRamsay would you like to try some of my penne arrabbiata pic.twitter.com/VLaJ1lgdQy â Darren Clarke (@darrenclarke93) February 20, 2017 
Ps Darren that's called spaghetti https://t.co/iOG5VZ1nPz â Gordon Ramsay (@GordonRamsay) February 20, 2017 
Don't worry, though, all hope is not lost: 
@GordonRamsay I made cinnamon rolls, what do you think? pic.twitter.com/ER1fnN5ykF
